intro: Euphrasia cousturieri, commonly known as the Turkish eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and the Caucasus. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Euphrasia cousturieri is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
